<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Tile tile: tiles){
  if(tile.getIndex() % 2 == 0){
    tile.draw();
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the modulo operator to check if the index is even or odd.
Question: How to get the value of a variable in a method?: I'm trying to get the value of a variable in a method, but I can't get it.
public class Test {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        int a = 10;
        int b = 20;
        int c = a + b;
        System.out.println(c);
    }
}
I want to get the value of c in the main method.
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: int c = a + b;
<<<explanation>>>: You can't get the value of a variable in a method. You can only get the value of a variable in the same method.
